smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

instances.message: The function createTimetableLocal has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.
The function createTimetableRemote has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.
The function createSemester has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

smells.name: ComplexInterface
smells.description: An interface contains too many functions and properties. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. An interface should have one responsibility. Split up large interfaces into smaller ones that are easier to understand.

smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class GradeStatisticsFragment is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: ComplexCondition
smells.description: Complex conditions should be simplified and extracted into well-named methods if necessary.

instances.message: This condition is too complex.

smells.name: TooGenericExceptionCaught

smells.name: MatchingDeclarationName
smells.description: If a source file contains only a single non-private top-level class or object, the file name should reflect the case-sensitive name plus the .kt extension.

smells.name: SpreadOperator
smells.description: Using a spread operator causes a full copy of the array to be created before calling a method has a very high performance penalty.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: UnnecessaryAbstractClass
smells.description: An abstract class is unnecessary and can be refactored. An abstract class should have both abstract and concrete properties or functions. An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface. An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

instances.message: An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses around the lambda ({ Timber.i("Update note result: Success") }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses around the lambda ({ Timber.d("Update message ${message.id} result: Success") }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses in (subjects.singleOrNull { it.name == name }?.name) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: subjects.singleOrNull { it.name == name }?.name
Parentheses around the lambda ({ Timber.i("Update grade result: Success") }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses in (R.drawable.ic_more_schoolandteachers) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: R.drawable.ic_more_schoolandteachers
Parentheses in (lesson.info.isNotBlank() && !lesson.canceled) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: lesson.info.isNotBlank() && !lesson.canceled
Parentheses in (presence + absence) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: presence + absence
Parentheses in (presence / (presence + absence)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: presence / (presence + absence)

smells.description: Optional braces in when expression

instances.message: Optional braces in when expression
Optional braces in when expression

smells.name: NestedClassesVisibility
smells.description: Nested types are often used for implementing private functionality and therefore this should not be public.

instances.message: Nested types are often used for implementing private functionality. However the visibility of LoginModule makes it visible externally.

smells.name: ThrowsCount
smells.description: Restrict the number of throw statements in methods.

instances.message: Too many throw statements in the function decrypt. The maximum number of allowed throw statements is 2.

smells.name: NewLineAtEndOfFile
smells.description: Checks whether files end with a line separator.

instances.message: The file FlexibleAdapterExtension.kt is not ending with a new line.

smells.name: PreferToOverPairSyntax
smells.description: Pair was created using the Pair constructor, using the to syntax is preferred.

instances.message: Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `message.realId to message.folderId`

smells.name: SerialVersionUIDInSerializableClass
smells.description: A class which implements the Serializable interface does not define a correct serialVersionUID field. The serialVersionUID field should be a constant long value inside a companion object.

instances.message: The class Timetable implements the Serializable interface and should thus define a serialVersionUID.
The class AttendanceSummary implements the Serializable interface and should thus define a serialVersionUID.
